intro: Diplostephium foliosum, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom throughout the year in warm climates. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Diplostephium foliosum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in sunny conditions.
